required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Espresso on Platelet Aggregability in Patients With Coronary Artery Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Effect of Espresso on Platelet Aggregability in Patients With Coronary Artery Disease

collaborator.agency: Fundação de Amparo à Pesquisa do Estado de São Paulo

brief_summary.textblock: Discovered thousands of years ago, coffee is among the most consumed beverages in the world. The relationship between coffee and cardiovascular risk, more specifically coronary artery disease, is controversial. Platelet aggregation and its relationship with coffee is also controversial. The investigators propose this study to evaluate the relationship between coffee and platelet aggregability in patients with coronary artery disease.

detailed_description.textblock: 30 patients with coronary artery disease (proven by previous coronary angiography) will be selected at the Heart Institute (InCor USP) for the study. Patients will be instructed to abstain from caffeinated beverages during 22 days. After this period, one group will consume caffeinated coffee during 28 days, followed by decaffeinated coffee during more 28 days and another group will start with decaffeinated coffee followed by caffeinated. All participants will receive "Nespresso" coffee maker "Essenza" model. The coffee "Nespresso blend voluto" will be provided (caffeinated and decaffeinated). The patients will have to take four cups of espresso per day (three cups a day for patients aged 65 and over). The investigators will evaluate platelet aggregation by Multiplate® (ASPI, ADP and arachidonic acid) and by optical aggregometry (ADP and arachidonic acid).

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This is a prospective, open label, controlled study

primary_outcome.measure: Platelet aggregation evaluated by Multiplate® ASPI
primary_outcome.description: Compare the inhibition of platelet aggregation evaluated by Multiplate® ASPI after 8 weeks of espresso consumption in relation to basal platelet aggregability (after coffee withdrawal period).

secondary_outcome.measure: Platelet aggregation evaluated by Multiplate® ADP e Arachidonic acid
secondary_outcome.description: Compare the inhibition of platelet aggregation evaluated by Multiplate® ADP and Arachidonic acid after 4 weeks of caffeinated coffee consumption with platelet aggregability after 4 weeks of decaffeinated coffee consumption.

secondary_outcome.measure: Platelet aggregation evaluated by Multiplate® ADP
secondary_outcome.description: Compare the inhibition of platelet aggregation evaluated by Multiplate® ADP after 8 weeks of espresso consumption in relation to basal platelet aggregability (after coffee withdrawal period).

secondary_outcome.measure: Platelet aggregation evaluated by optical aggregometry (ADP and arachidonic acid) 1
secondary_outcome.description: Compare platelet aggregability by optical aggregometry (ADP and arachidonic acid) after 8 weeks of espresso consumption in relation to basal platelet aggregability (after coffee withdrawal period).

secondary_outcome.measure: Platelet aggregation evaluated by optical aggregometry (ADP and arachidonic acid)
secondary_outcome.description: Compare the inhibition of platelet aggregation evaluated by optical aggregometry (ADP and arachidonic acid) after 4 weeks of caffeinated coffee consumption with platelet aggregability after 4 weeks of decaffeinated coffee consumption.

other_outcome.measure: Compare platelet aggregation by Multiplate® ASPI in the following subgroup: Elderly (≥65 years) and non-elderly
other_outcome.description: Compare platelet aggregation by Multiplate® ASPI after 8 weeks of espresso consumption in relation to basal platelet aggregability (after coffee withdrawal period) in the following subgroup: Elderly (≥65 years) and non-elderly

other_outcome.measure: Compare platelet aggregation by Multiplate® ASPI in the following subgroup: Feminine and masculine genders
other_outcome.description: Compare platelet aggregation by Multiplate® ASPI after 8 weeks of espresso consumption in relation to basal platelet aggregability (after coffee withdrawal period) in the following subgroup: Feminine and masculine genders

other_outcome.measure: Compare platelet aggregation by Multiplate® ASPI in the following subgroup: Renal dysfunction (Creatinine > 1.8mg/dl) and without renal dysfunction
other_outcome.description: Compare platelet aggregation by Multiplate® ASPI after 8 weeks of espresso consumption in relation to basal platelet aggregability (after coffee withdrawal period) in the following subgroup: Renal dysfunction (Creatinine > 1.8mg/dl) and without renal dysfunction

other_outcome.measure: Compare platelet aggregation by Multiplate® ASPI in the following subgroup: Obese (BMI≥30 Kg/m2) and non-obese
other_outcome.description: Compare platelet aggregation by Multiplate® ASPI after 8 weeks of espresso consumption in relation to basal platelet aggregability (after coffee withdrawal period) in the following subgroup: Obese (BMI≥30 Kg/m2) and non-obese

other_outcome.measure: Compare platelet aggregation by Multiplate® ASPI in the following subgroup: Glycemia >99mg/dl and no change in fasting glycemia
other_outcome.description: Compare platelet aggregation by Multiplate® ASPI after 8 weeks of espresso consumption in relation to basal platelet aggregability (after coffee withdrawal period) in the following subgroup: Glycemia >99mg/dl and no change in fasting glycemia

other_outcome.measure: Compare platelet aggregation by Multiplate® ASPI in the following subgroup: With of Beta-blocker and without
other_outcome.description: Compare platelet aggregation by Multiplate® ASPI after 8 weeks of espresso consumption in relation to basal platelet aggregability (after coffee withdrawal period) in the following subgroup: With of Beta-blocker and without

other_outcome.measure: Compare platelet aggregation by Multiplate® ASPI in the following subgroup: With statin and without
other_outcome.description: Compare platelet aggregation by Multiplate® ASPI after 8 weeks of espresso consumption in relation to basal platelet aggregability (after coffee withdrawal period) in the following subgroup: With statin and without

other_outcome.measure: Delta change of platelet aggregation and Fraction of immature platelets (PFI)
other_outcome.description: Correlate the delta change of platelet aggregation of the basal in relation to 8 weeks of coffee use in relation to: Fraction of immature platelets (PFI)

other_outcome.measure: Delta change of platelet aggregation and Small-LDL
other_outcome.description: Correlate the delta change of platelet aggregation of the basal in relation to 8 weeks of coffee use in relation to: Small-LDL

other_outcome.measure: Delta change of platelet aggregation and Fasting glycemia
other_outcome.description: Correlate the delta change of platelet aggregation of the basal in relation to 8 weeks of coffee use in relation to: Fasting glycemia

other_outcome.measure: Delta change of platelet aggregation and Glycated hemoglobin
other_outcome.description: Correlate the delta change of platelet aggregation of the basal in relation to 8 weeks of coffee use in relation to: Glycated hemoglobin

other_outcome.measure: Delta change of platelet aggregation and Lipid profile
other_outcome.description: Correlate the delta change of platelet aggregation of the basal in relation to 8 weeks of coffee use in relation to: Lipid profile (total cholesterol, HDL [high-density lipoprotein], LDL [low-density lipoprotein], very low-density lipoprotein [VLDL] and triglycerides)

other_outcome.measure: Delta change of platelet aggregation and Lipoprotein a
other_outcome.description: Correlate the delta change of platelet aggregation of the basal in relation to 8 weeks of coffee use in relation to: Lipoprotein a - Lp(a)

other_outcome.measure: Delta change of platelet aggregation and Sirtuins
other_outcome.description: Correlate the delta change of platelet aggregation of the basal in relation to 8 weeks of coffee use in relation to: Sirtuins

other_outcome.measure: Delta change of platelet aggregation and Advanced glycation final product (RAGE) receiver
other_outcome.description: Correlate the delta change of platelet aggregation of the basal in relation to 8 weeks of coffee use in relation to: Advanced glycation final product (RAGE) receiver

arm_group.description: Patients will be instructed to abstain from caffeinated beverages during 22 days. After this period, they will consume caffeinated coffee during 28 days, followed by decaffeinated coffee during more 28 days.

Patients will be instructed to abstain from caffeinated beverages during 22 days. After this period, they will consume decaffeinated coffee during 28 days, followed by caffeinated coffee during more 28 days.

intervention.description: Participants will receive "Nespresso" coffee maker "Essenza" model. The coffee "Nespresso blend voluto" will be provided (caffeinated and decaffeinated). The patients will have to take four cups of espresso per day (three cups a day for patients aged 65 and over).
